plugins.name: Team Library Component Attacher
plugins.description:
Provides to replace the frames with Team Library Component(Design System).


What It can help...

- Recover components which lost any links.

 - when you move your frames to another file.

 - when imported a Sketch file.

- Replace your frames with the component which belongs to Team Library.


How to Use

0. Make sure the target Frame, Group and Instance name and Team Library component name are same.

 - NOTE: Set the child component name when you use Variants.

1. Open your Team Library file and run Save master components.

2. Choose the target Frames, Groups, Instances then run Replace all selections with saved master components.


Known issues & Feature requests

üößAny text and other properties will be lost when replace them with instances.

https://github.com/rei-suzuki/figma-team-component-attacher/issues


Welcome your contributions!

plugins.name: Jumpback

1. SAVE Current Spot

2. JUMP to Saved Spot

3. CLEAR Saved Spot (to make way for a new one)


USE CASE EXAMPLE

Joe is working on the latest update to the home screen for an app. He sees Jenny‚Äôs cursor come over, ‚ÄúHey Joe, come take a look at something.‚ÄùJoe wants to help her out, so he follows her over where she‚Äôs been doing updates on the Settings screen. He spends 10 minutes giving his feedback, but now he's ready to get back over to where he was working.The problem is, there‚Äôs multiple pages in this file, and 100+ screens... where was he?! Jumpback

plugins.name: Variables Documentation
plugins.description:
Variables Documentation

Document your design system variables with clarity and precision. This plugin creates comprehensive, customizable documentation for Figma variables, making your design tokens accessible and shareable.


Key Features


  1. Generate professional tables showing variable values across all modes
  2. Visualize colors with swatches, hex codes, and transparency
  3. Track variable relationships with clear alias references and resolved values
  4. Filter and search through large variable collections easily
  5. Choose between multiple display styles and customization options
  6. Customize table appearance with company branding
  7. Preserve variable hierarchy in organized documentation
  8. Handle large design systems efficiently with optimized performance


Simple Workflow


  1. Select your variable collection
  2. Choose variables to document
  3. Customize display settings
  4. Generate your documentation
  5. Share with your team


Perfect for design system teams, documentation specialists, and designers who need to communicate design tokens clearly. Save time and maintain consistency with automated variable documentation.
plugins.tagline: Create beautiful documentation tables for all your Figma variables

plugins.name: Slot Editor
plugins.description:
Much like how components work on the web, Slot Editor lets you make any content within a component a slot, allowing you to make changes without effecting other instances.


Making a slot


  1. To make a slot, select one or more objects within a component.
  2. Run the plugin command Make Slot. This will turn the content into an instance.


Editing a slot


  1. Select one or more slots or instances with slots
  2. Run the plugin command Edit Slot. This will make all slots editable in place.
  3. When you're done making changes, click Done in the notification below.


Alternatively you can edit any slot by selecting an instance or slot and clicking Edit Slot from the the Properties Panel.


Removing a slot


  1. Select one or more objects with slots within them.
  2. Run the plugin command Remove Slot. This will not remove the object itself.


The plugin won't remove nested slots. To remove these, run command again until there are no slots left.


Things to know


When you select any content inside a component and make it into a slot the plugin replaces it with an instance of that content. It first creates a component with the content inside, then replaces that with an instance of that component.


When you edit a slot it creates a unique instance of the content inside that slot. Any changes you make will be private to that instance.


Because of this you should be aware that if you make changes to the contents of slots inside a component, they will not be reflected in any instances created from that component (unless they haven't been edited). For this reason, it is best to make a placeholder for your slot, rather than turn existing content into a slot.


If you delete a slot from a component, it will remove the respective slot from any instances that were using that slot.

accepted.name: Gavin McFarland
accepted.description: Freelance Designer and Developer who loves making things

plugins.tagline: Make re-usable components that you can slot modular content into

plugins.name: Variables Lint
plugins.description:
Variable Lint is Figma plugin to help in variable management and streamline design consistency.


Key Features:


Variable Stats: Gain valuable insights into variable usage with detailed statistics, including:


Track Assigned Variables: Track the number of variables currently in use across your design.


Identify Unused Variables: Identify variables that are defined but remain unutilized within your document.


Fix orphaned Variables: Detect variables that were previously assigned but are no longer linked to any elements.

Error Detection: Variable Lint intelligently detects and flags errors related to variable usage, such as:


Nodes missing Variables: Highlight instances where variables should be used but are hardcoded instead. Identify areas where variables could enhance design consistency but have not been applied.


With Variable Lint, designers can elevate their variable management practices, promoting design system consistency and accelerating the design iteration process.


Buy me coffee

accepted.name: Sunny
accepted.description: Solving some of the use cases my team encounters when working in Figma.

plugins.tagline: Linting for you document variables

plugins.name: Math-X - TeX/LaTeX to SVG
plugins.description:
"Math-X - TeX/LaTeX to SVG" is a plugin that converts TeX/LaTeX equations into editable SVG images. This tool enables you to create mathematical equations and formulas within your Figma designs.


How to Use:

  1. Type your TeX/LaTeX equation into the provided input field.
  2. Click "Create" to generate the SVG image, or enable AutoSync to update the SVG result in real-time.
  3. Drag and drop the resulting SVG directly onto your Figma canvas or use the insert button.


For easy future reference and editing, the plugin stores the original TeX/LaTeX equation in the SVG's frame name.


The official website: math-x.com

Created by Elia Jabbour
plugins.tagline: Convert TeX/LaTeX to editable SVG images.

plugins.name: JSON data
plugins.description:
This is an alpha release.


Forever free tool for checking the design on real world data. This is getting done by populating the file with JSON data prepared in advance in any text editor. Further updates might be aimed at getting the data from existing websites.


How to use:

  1. Define titles of the text layers.
  2. Create JSON-file in any text editor.
  3. Usage in Figma: select group with objects. Better to use the parent group.
  4. Insert the JSON content into the plugin text field.
  5. Click ‚ÄòApply JSON‚Äô button.


You can update data until you close the plugin.


How it works


Plugin searches for text field titles and populates them with JSON data if there is a match.


Some bugs are expected, plugin is provided AS IS, author is not to blame for any content loss.


TODO: hiding the layer on Null data received.
plugins.tagline: Plugin helps to populate dummy content with a production-ready content specified in JSON

plugins.name: Scrim That
plugins.description:
Quickly add a scrim over a selected layer with Scrim That.


Want to create a scrim over your design to overlay a dialog box? But hate having to resize the scrim to match the width, height and correct layer position?


Scrim That has you covered with one-click magic scrimming.


Usage

Select a frame, group or shape layer and run the plugin to create the scrim over it.

Then tweak the styling of the layer as desired.


Open Source

Scrim That is open source, and contributions are most welcome.

accepted.name: Aashrey Sharma
accepted.description: Senior UX Designer @ Epic Games

plugins.tagline: Quickly add a scrim over a selected layer

plugins.name: Fluid Color Palettes
plugins.description:
Unleash the Power of Dynamic, Variable-Based Color Palettes in Figma


---

Generator your palettes: https://colors.fluid-design.io

Then paste the figma link into the plugin - And you're done!

---


When it comes to design, color is king‚Äîbut managing your color palette shouldn't be a royal pain. Our Figma plugin simplifies the process like never before, allowing you to:


  1. Generate 1000+ Dynamic Variables with stepped-opacity: Instead of static color codes, receive variable-based palettes for total design flexibility. Switch between light and dark modes with zero manual adjustments. Then you can use your colors as variables like: color/primary/50, color/gray/100 or with opacity color/accent/500/95 or brand/foreground/70!
  2. One-Click Brand Palette Customization: Automatically generate a 'Brand Palette' designed for diverse use-cases like background, foreground, and more‚Äîall based on your chosen base colors.
  3. Seamless Design-to-Development Workflow: With one generated link, effortlessly integrate your palette into Figma and simultaneously generate color tokens for TailwindCSS and shadcn/ui. Ensure design consistency across platforms and speed up project timelines.


Close the Gap Between Design and Development

Our plugin doesn't just save designers time‚Äîit builds bridges between design and development teams. By generating unified color tokens, we ensure consistency and ease-of-use across various platforms. No more back-and-forths over color codes; just a single, harmonious workflow.


Affordable, One-Time Purchase

For a fixed one-time payment, gain lifetime access to all premium functionalities. Say goodbye to manual adjustments and accelerate your design workflow‚Äîit's a game-changing investment that pays off instantly.


The Science Behind the Palette‚ÄîSimplified

We employ advanced color science to make sure your palettes are not just stunning, but functional. And for those concerned with accessibility, rest assured: our colors meet WCAG 2.1 and APCA standards. But don't worry about the complexities‚Äîour plugin does all the heavy lifting, so you can focus on what you do best: designing. And for those who're interested digging how these colors were picked, checkout the color science page.


Effortless Updates

Update your palette via our website at any time.


Ready to elevate your design workflow? Install our plugin today and experience the future of color management in Figma.

accepted.name: Oliver Pan
accepted.description: UX designer

plugins.tagline: Fully variable-based colors. TailwindCSS-styled palettes. shadcn/ui color theme.

94129.description:
Unleash the Power of Dynamic, Variable-Based Color Palettes in Figma


---

Generator your palettes: https://colors.fluid-design.io

Then paste the figma link into the plugin - And you're done!

---


When it comes to design, color is king‚Äîbut managing your color palette shouldn't be a royal pain. Our Figma plugin simplifies the process like never before, allowing you to:


  1. Generate 1000+ Dynamic Variables with stepped-opacity: Instead of static color codes, receive variable-based palettes for total design flexibility. Switch between light and dark modes with zero manual adjustments. Then you can use your colors as variables like: color/primary/50, color/gray/100 or with opacity color/accent/500/95 or brand/foreground/70!
  2. One-Click Brand Palette Customization: Automatically generate a 'Brand Palette' designed for diverse use-cases like background, foreground, and more‚Äîall based on your chosen base colors.
  3. Seamless Design-to-Development Workflow: With one generated link, effortlessly integrate your palette into Figma and simultaneously generate color tokens for TailwindCSS and shadcn/ui. Ensure design consistency across platforms and speed up project timelines.


Close the Gap Between Design and Development

Our plugin doesn't just save designers time‚Äîit builds bridges between design and development teams. By generating unified color tokens, we ensure consistency and ease-of-use across various platforms. No more back-and-forths over color codes; just a single, harmonious workflow.


Affordable, One-Time Purchase

For a fixed one-time payment, gain lifetime access to all premium functionalities. Say goodbye to manual adjustments and accelerate your design workflow‚Äîit's a game-changing investment that pays off instantly.


The Science Behind the Palette‚ÄîSimplified

We employ advanced color science to make sure your palettes are not just stunning, but functional. And for those concerned with accessibility, rest assured: our colors meet WCAG 2.1 and APCA standards. But don't worry about the complexities‚Äîour plugin does all the heavy lifting, so you can focus on what you do best: designing. And for those who're interested digging how these colors were picked, checkout the color science page.


Effortless Updates

Update your palette via our website at any time.


Ready to elevate your design workflow? Install our plugin today and experience the future of color management in Figma.

plugins.name: Babel Translations
plugins.description:
The plugin uses DeepL API to automatically translate nodes or screens in Figma. v1.0


Prerequisites

Free version of DeepL API has a limitation of 500.000 symbols which you can translate, the plugin provides you an option to use your own subscription plan (Free, Pro or Enterprise) by providing an AuthKey during the onboarding process.


Supported Features

  • Free for all. You don't pay for the plugin itself as well as for basic version of DeepL, but I would be happy if you would like to buy me a coffee.
  • Translate one or multiple selected *visible* nodes including their children.
  • Use "formality" option to translate to a more formal or informal language.
  • Use "Auto" option to automatically detect the language of the text to translate from.
  • Automatically saves the language you were translating 'from' and 'to', to speedup the process.
  • Ignore certain Text nodes by adding a keyword `:babel_ignore:` to their name.
  • Handles errors gracefully.
  • Handles loss of connection gracefully.


Roadmap

Version 1.0 of the plugin covers only necessary features for an effective translation workflow, but we are using the plugin internally at BearMinds and we see many features which would make it even better.

  • Keep styles of the original text.
  1. bold, italic, underline
  2. font size
  3. font family
  4. color
  • Option to ignore certain group of nodes when translating.
  • split_sentences option to sets whether the translation engine should first split the input into sentences
  • tag_handling option to support html and xml tags
  • preserve_formatting option to preserve formatting of the original text, even if it would usually correct some aspects.
  • ignore_tags option to ensure that elements in the original text are not altered in the translation (e.g., trademarks, product names)
  • Detect that component is selected and warn about potential breaking changes propagation.
  • Translate a lot of text at once (e.g. 10000x symbols)


Feedback

We would be happy to hear about your experience with the plugin, missing features or issues. Just write to hello@bearminds.com.
plugins.tagline: Speed up processes by automatically translating components using the power of the DeepL

plugins.name: Trados Translation Connector for Figma
plugins.description:
You've got content to translate and you want to do it directly from Figma ‚Äì quickly, easily and efficiently. All it takes is to connect Figma to the world's most-used translation technology: Trados.


Trados is a next-generation translation platform that uses AI and other smart technologies to make localization processes more agile and secure. Businesses with global growth ambitions use Trados to streamline and automate their localization workflows, manage translation resources more effectively and securely, and improve brand consistency. Through Trados you can send content to any language service provider, in-house or external.


This Trados translation connector easily connects Figma to your Trados solution to create a seamless end-to-end process for localization. Users of Figma can then easily push content to Trados and receive the localized content back once translated. They have visibility of the whole process and control over the elements they need, including cost approval and review. It couldn't be simpler.

plugins.name: Find & replace variables
plugins.description:
Figma Plugin: Find Replace Variables

This plugin is particularly beneficial when you have numerous variables with a similar naming structure, and you want to assign new variables by replacing parts of the variable names.


Functionality

The Find Replace Variables plugin locates and replaces variables in your Figma files. It accomplishes this by conducting a replace operation on the names of bound variables. You can do this by entering a simple string or a regex pattern.

Upon identifying the variables to be modified, the plugin will then search for variables with the new name, either locally or in any enabled library. If a match is found, it will substitute the old variable with the new one.


Usage

To use the Find Replace Variables plugin, follow these steps:

  1. Select the node(s) in your Figma file where you want to replace variables.
  2. Run the Find Replace Variables plugin with UI (Open) or in the Figma Quick Action Bar (Quick Run).
  3. Enter the string or regex pattern for the find operation.
  4. Enter the string or regex pattern for the replace operation.
  5. Run the plugin. It will replace all instances of matching variables within the selected nodes.


Example

If your variable names follow a specific structure and you often need to change multiple variables with the same naming structure, this is for you!


For example, if your variables are:

blue / 50
blue / 100
blue / 200
red / 50
red / 100
red / 200


You can change your design from blue to red by using ‚Äúfind and replace variables‚Äù blue ‚Üí red with a single command.


Roadmap

  1. Add a preview component to the UI that checks for matching variables and replacement on the fly.


Features

  1. Supports all variable types
  2. Use normal text or regex
  3. Use UI or quick action menu


Get started

  1. Find and replace variables is free for 3 runs per file
  2. Use across an unlimited number of files
  3. No subscription fees
  4. Get individual lifetime access for a one-time fee of $69 (limited time offer).


Limitations

You can‚Äôt use this on instances that have bound variables as an override.


Why not free?

Despite being a very simple plugin, it saves you a great amount of time if you really need to use it more than 3 times per file. I put a lot of effort and time into developing this plugin, while I could have done client work. By valuing my work and supporting me, you enable me to work on other ideas that could potentially help you be even more efficient in the future.


Feedback

If you have any feedback or something doesn‚Äôt work, open an issue here.
plugins.tagline: Find & replace for all variables in your selection.

plugins.name: Mode Inspector (Beta)
plugins.description:
üì¢ Request for feedback!

Hi all! This is a very simple Dev Mode only plugin that I built to help a very simple use case around showing translations stored in other variable modes.


I'm really keen to add more to it but to do that I'll need you to give direction around other things functionality you'd like the tool to have.


Please leave a comment or fill out this feedback form if you have any suggestions!


Plugin Description

Fairly lightweight plugin that allows developers to see variable values in different modes, without needing edit access, and without needing designers to duplicate every piece of UI just so they can extract data.


This is especially useful for things like translation, if you have a need to pull out strings one by one.


Note: This is currently in Beta and only supports string variables at the moment. If you have another need, or any feedback on how it currently works, please let me know!

plugins.name: Design Feedback
plugins.description:
Improve your UI designs with instant detailed design feedback. This intuitive plugin provides personalized, actionable feedback within Figma, streamlining your design process and enhancing the quality of your work.


What Does it Do?

  • Comprehensive Analysis: From visual hierarchy to usability, this plugin examines your design across several critical aspects, ensuring no detail is overlooked.
  • Balanced Review: It highlights what's working well and what needs improvement, providing a balanced perspective that respects your design's unique style.
  • Actionable Recommendations: You receive specific, easy-to-understand suggestions for improvement.
  • Inclusive Design Focus: With a keen eye on accessibility and responsiveness, it ensures your designs are universally usable and aesthetically pleasing across all devices.


How It Works

  1. Upload & Analyze: Select your UI frame and let the plugin dissect its elements.
  2. Receive Expert Feedback: Instantly get structured, insightful feedback.
  3. Refine & Excel: Apply the suggestions, elevate your design quality, and learn best practices.


Ideal for Aspiring and Seasoned Designers

"Design Feedback" is a game-changer, especially for novice and intermediate designers seeking to hone their skills. It offers clear, instructive feedback that's easy to implement. Experts will also find value in its fresh insights and design affirmations.


Why Choose Design Feedback?

  • Saves Time: Get instant, expert-level critique without the wait.
  • Improves Design Quality: Elevate your designs with professional insights.
  • Educational: Learn best practices and common pitfalls in UI design.


Ready to transform your design process?

Embrace the power of expert feedback at your fingertips with "Design Feedback" ‚Äì your personal design consultant within Figma.
plugins.tagline: Perfect your UI designs with instant detailed design feedback

plugins.name: Format AI
plugins.description:
Edit text as intended with Format.

Spellcheck, change text length and format text instantly with Format.


AI Features

  • Spellcheck: Say goodbye to typos and errors!
  • Text Length Control: Easily shorten or extend text to fit your layout requirements.
  • Text Auto-Adjust: Rewrite text so that it fits its textbox.
  • Text Format: Transform messy text into well-organized structure.
  • More features coming soon!


Basic Features

  • Merge multiple nodes into a single text node.
  • Split text node by line breaks.
  • Remove styling from multiple text nodes (hyperlinks, underscores and strikethroughs).


Instructions

  1. Select your text nodes.
  2. Open Quick Actions [Ctrl + /] or [Cmd + /].
  3. Type a command (e.g. Merge or Split).
  4. Press Enter/Return.


Reach Out

We are currently working on new features and would be happy to hear your suggestions. Please write us at inbox@debrief.design
plugins.tagline: Working with text made easy

plugins.name: Crunch Image Optimization
plugins.description:
Optimize Groups, Layers, and Images before adding them to your sites.


We all know that keeping up with image optimization can fall off the radar really fast when you are cycling through design and approval. Leaving a lot on the developer to clean-up. Thankfully with Dev Mode you can now optimize your images right in Figma. No more need to export images, run to another program or the web, then upload to your site or development flow.


Optimize and review your designs right in Dev Mode by using JPEG or PNG image compression.


  1. Source: Choose between the source* image or the layer itself
  2. Scale: Adjust the scale you want the image to be optimized in
  3. Quality: Adjust quality to fine-tune your image
  4. Inspect: Pinch zoom on trackpads or ctrlKey + scroll to zoom image or drag your image around to see inspect the optimization.
  5. Optimized images will be displayed in the lower section of the Inspect Panel.


*Your fill needs to be the top-most fill in the Fill panel

plugins.name: Otto
plugins.description:
Hello! Meet Otto.


Otto is a very special caterpillar who lives inside Figma. Otto is rather shy and avoids attention (especially if you look like a hungry bird).


No one quite knows how Otto burrowed his way into Figma. For years, Otto has survived by munching on discarded letters and words deleted from text boxes in Figma files.


Unfortunately for Otto, Figma developers aren‚Äôt big fans of bugs living in their software. So Otto does his very best to stay very hidden, living a quiet, calm life on the leaves of Figma‚Äôs gigantic node tree.


While Figma has countless users worldwide, few have actually seen even a glimpse of Otto in the wild ‚Ä¶ until today!


That‚Äôs because Otto has a secret superpower: He can type fast.


I mean, really, really, really fast.


Otto doesn‚Äôt like to brag about his special talent. But, if you ask him nicely to type something for you, he‚Äôll do it. (While shy, Otto is always willing to help others.)


This plugin lets you send typing requests to Otto. Just use a special character to wake him up, then type in a single character that matches up to the words or sentences you want him to type out. 


Otto types so quickly, you still won‚Äôt be able to see him ‚Äî but you‚Äôll definitely see the trail of letters he leaves in his wake.


Thanks to Otto, you can be more efficient with text: Avoid typing the same word or sentence manually over and over. (This also gives Otto some much-needed exercise.)


This plugin even helps the environment! Otto types exclusively with 100% recycled text letters from deleted Figma files. (Fun fact: Otto has one of the world‚Äôs largest collections of the word ‚ÄúUntitled‚Äù for some mysterious reason.)


If you have a question for Otto, please share it in the comments and I‚Äôll see if I can get an answer from him. (Usually, I have to get Otto to type something such as ‚ÄòHey Otto! What‚Äôs up?‚Äô to get his attention.)


-----


Finally, one minor FYI: Otto is usually very comfortable moving around in Figma, whether it‚Äôs a sticky note or a text box (he‚Äôs even been known to chew on the text in a connector arrow from time to time).


However, Otto is very skittish around code blocks and can‚Äôt wait to escape them (with so many coders hunting for bugs, I can‚Äôt blame him one bit). So if you ask him to type something in the middle of a code block, he‚Äôll do it ‚Äî but Otto will immediately dash to the end of the text. If you‚Äôd call this a bug ‚Ä¶ well, that bug‚Äôs name is Otto!

accepted.name: Nelson Taruc
accepted.description: My design philosophy: Focus. Boost signal, kill noise. Solve the first problem. Embrace uncertainty.

plugins.name: Auto Rename Frames with AI Suggestions
plugins.description:
Auto Rename helps you easily rename or label frames you select in bulk.


With this tool, you can:

  1. Drag a region to select frames you want to rename in bulk.
  2. Select frames based on its properties, such as Mobile, Desktop or Interactive Frames.
  3. Get smart AI** suggested frame names. (new!)
  4. Automatically add a Label, or rename selected frames.


Auto Frame Label is meant to help designers reduce the time needed to organise Figma frames in large files. With that, it allows designers to fully focus on our craft.


**This particular AI uses a library to comprehend what the frames are about, and generates a few options for you to choose from. It might not always work, but serves as a fast way to rename contextually.


How to use:

  1. Open plugin on Figma or Figjam.
  2. Choose the type of method to select frames.
  3. Select frames.
  4. Add Labels or Rename.


by Yuan Jie

accepted.name: Yuan Jie
accepted.description:
Product Designer/Developer

Making simple tools to help designers design more efficiently. In particular, tools to help visualise big amount of data.

plugins.name: HTML to Figma by html.tofig.design ‚Äî Import Websites, Code & AI Content
plugins.description:
html.tofig.design: Transform Websites & HTML into Editable Figma Designs


Instantly convert any live website, HTML code, CSS, or even AI-generated code into fully editable Figma designs using html.tofig.design. Stop wasting time manually recreating web elements. Our powerful tool imports webpages and code directly into Figma with all layers, text, and styles preserved and ready for you to customize.


Accelerate Your Design Workflow


Why build from scratch? html.tofig.design lets you kickstart your design process by starting with existing websites or codebases. It's the perfect solution for:


  1. Redesigning existing websites without starting from zero.
  2. Creating benchmarks or moodboards in Figma using real website elements.
  3. Performing competitive analysis directly within your design environment.
  4. Prototyping and testing variations based on live web content.
  5. Quickly grabbing needed design assets from any website.


Key Features to Boost Your Productivity:


  1. Website to Figma Conversion: Convert entire live websites into editable Figma files.
  2. Direct HTML/CSS Code Import: Paste HTML or CSS code directly into our editor and turn it into design elements.
  3. AI-Generated Code Support: Seamlessly import designs generated by AI tools.
  4. Multi-Viewport Import: Capture desktop, tablet, and mobile views simultaneously.
  5. Editable Layers: All imported elements are organized, layered, and fully editable in Figma.
  6. Preserves Styles: Maintains typography, colors, spacing, and other CSS styles.
  7. Private & Login-Protected Site Conversion: Easily import secure websites using our browser extension.
  8. Local File Import: Convert local HTML files or ZIP archives.


How to Convert a Website to Figma with html.tofig.design:


Getting started is simple:


  1. Open the plugin menu in Figma and launch html.tofig.design.
  2. Enter the website URL you want to convert.
  3. Select the viewports (desktop, mobile, tablet) you need.
  4. Click "Import" and watch your website appear in Figma!


Convert Private Websites & Local Files:


Need to import a site behind a login or work with files on your computer? Download our Chrome extension for effortless conversion of private websites. You can also use the file import option for local HTML or .ZIP files.
plugins.tagline: Convert websites, HTML/CSS, and AI-generated code into fully editable Figma designs

  6. Preserves Styles: Maintains typography, colors, spacing, and other CSS styles.
  7. Private & Login-Protected Site Conversion: Easily import secure websites using our browser extension.
  8. Local File Import: Convert local HTML files or ZIP archives.


How to Convert a Website to Figma with html.tofig.design:


Getting started is simple:


  1. Open the plugin menu in Figma and launch html.tofig.design.
  2. Enter the website URL you want to convert.
  3. Select the viewports (desktop, mobile, tablet) you need.
  4. Click "Import" and watch your website appear in Figma!


Convert Private Websites & Local Files:


Need to import a site behind a login or work with files on your computer? Download our Chrome extension for effortless conversion of private websites. You can also use the file import option for local HTML or .ZIP files.

networkAccess.reasoning: html.tofig.design does not transmit any information about your Figma files. The html.tofig.design backend (h.tofig.design) converts URLs to a Figma model, which is only stored temporarily on Cloudflare R2 bucket and/or Google storage bucket depending on their size (dl.tofig.design) for the plugin to download.

131203.tagline: Convert websites, HTML/CSS, and AI-generated code into fully editable Figma designs

plugins.name: Polystar
plugins.description:
How does it work?


1) Select one styled object on your document.


2) Play.


3) Click on "Place" button.


-> Your shape will get the same styling as the selected object and will be placed next to it.


4) Go on with the flow and keep exploring new shapes.


-> Each new shape will be placed next to the previous one and take on any style properties that might have been applied to it.


NOTE: Polystar currently supports Frames, Rectangles, Ellipses, Polygons, and Vectors. More options to give you greater control over how shapes are placed in your document are in the development pipeline and will be available soon.


-------------------------------------------------------------------

Would you like to support the development of new features and plugins?

You can buy me a coffee.


Thank you!

plugins.name: Zoomies
plugins.description:
Zoomies helps you magnify and highlight specific parts of your design work. It's handy for presenting, sharing, and critiquing your designs.


To use Zoomies:

  1. Create a circle (using the ellipse tool).
  2. Place it over the area you want to magnify, at the top level of the canvas. (Hold spacebar to keep the ellipse from nesting.)
  3. With the circle selected, run the plugin.


Note that the ellipse layer must be at the highest (canvas) level. If it's nested within a frame, the plugin won't work.

accepted.name: Ryan Reid
accepted.description: UX Writer @ Figma
